text.p: Stockfeed manafacturer Ridley Corp Ltd said on Monday it had bought Farmstock Stockfeeds Pty Ltd, a Queensland feed milling business that was a unit of Grainco Ltd.
The acquisition would be financed using existing banking facilities and a placement of about 4.3 million shares with the Grainco group, Ridley said.

Farmstock operates five feedmills which are located at Clifton, Biloela, Rockhampton, Monto and Clermont in Queensland and it owns a feedmill in Gunnedah, New South Wales. Farmstock also makes premix feed at a plant near Toowoomba in Queensland.
Farmstock produces about 90,000 tonnes of stockfeed annualy has a capacity to produce significantly more, Ridley said.

"This acquisition is consistent with Ridley's strategy to continue to improve the geographic spread of our Australian feed business and in so doing, ensure our quality feed products are available to an increasing number of livestock producers," Ridley chief executive Gary Busenshut said in a statement.
